authors.authr: MVM Rt. Hungarian Power Companies LTD.

abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment deals with
            the construction and maintenance of the Quick Start Gas
            Turbine Power Plant Project at two different locations,
            Liter and Sajoszoged, in Hungary.  The potential
            environmental impacts include: a) construction: noise and
            dust levels as well as construction wastes; b) air pollution
            and air quality: emission of dust, nitrous oxide and sulfur
            dioxide; c) soil quality: oil manipulation; d) surface and
            subsurface water quality: wastewater; and airborne
            admissions; e) handling and storage of raw materials and
            wastes; and f) noise emissions; and other impacts.  All of
            the impacts are negligible or within Hungarian standards.
            The impacts will be mitigated by the following measures: a)
            emission reduction through water ejection in the combustion
            chamber or by appropriate burner construction; b) collection
            and transportation of communal wastes, including separation
            of oily wastes; c) noise protection by silencers, special
            sound insulation and casing; d) accident prevention by
            infrastructure improvements; e) earthquake precautions; and
            f) fire protection and decontamination procedures.
